author: Neydja Petithomme
title: Samaritan's Purse volunteers help flood-ravaged Texas
text:
KERRVILLE, TX (WLOS) â€” The Samaritan's Purse, an evangelical Christian humanitarian aid organization based in Boone, North Carolina, and the Billy Graham Evangelistic Association's Rapid Response Team (BGEA-RRT) have deployed to hard-hit Kerr County, Texas, following the catastrophic deadly flooding.
SAMARITAN'S PURSE SENDS AID, VOLUNTEERS TO CENTRAL TEXAS AFTER DEADLY FLASH FLOODS
Approximately 90 volunteers are on the grounds, along with a Disaster Relief Unit equipped with additional tools and supplies.
SCIENTISTS WARN CLIMATE CHANGE IS FUELING MORE FREQUENT, INTENSE FLASH FLOODS NATIONWIDE
As of Wednesday, July 9, the deadly Texas flooding has left a trail of extensive damage and claimed more than 100 lives, with more still missing.
"The flooding here is horrific," said Jason Kimak, who is the senior director of the North American Ministry (NAM), with Samaritan's Purse. "The water got so fast, it was difficult for residents to even see. At the house that I'm at now, they quickly just had a few minutes to grab their things and head out, while other neighbors are not able to do so."
Kimak said volunteers are currently stationed in Kerrville, near the disaster zone.
ASHEVILLE MAYOR OFFERS SUPPORT TO TEXAS CITIES REELING FROM DEADLY FLASH FLOODS
"We're spread out around the area, doing different mud-out jobs," he said.
Kimak said his team will remain on the ground until further notice to continue assessing the recovery efforts.
